title: [K-12] Geometric Learning through PMRI-based Project Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic geometric concepts (circle, cone, cylinder), methods for calculating volume and area, and logical thinking skills for problem-solving
context.additional_context: Learners focus on solving real-life problems based on practical experience and can access simple multimedia materials via smartphone apps.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the components of a sphere (radius, diameter, surface area, volume) through case analysis in the Syawalan traditional cultural context.
Learners can design an experimental process and derive results for calculating the surface area and volume of a sphere using physical materials (oranges, seeds, etc.).
Learners can logically express the derivation process of the sphere volume formula through comparison with a cylinder.
Learners can solve and present real-world problems (packaging design, craft production, etc.) applying spherical geometry principles in a project format.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
